Use for complex artifacts requiring state management, routing, or shadcn/ui components - not for simple single-file HTML/JSX artifacts.

security_audit.summary: This skill consists of shell scripts that initialize React projects and bundle them into single HTML files for Claude artifacts. The code behavior matches its stated purpose. Scripts create files in the project directory and execute standard build tools (pnpm, npm, tar). No credential theft, data exfiltration, or persistence mechanisms detected.

low_findings.title: External package installation
low_findings.description: The scripts install npm packages from the npm registry which could theoretically include malicious dependencies. Lines: `pnpm add -D parcel @parcel/config-default...` and `pnpm install...`. An attacker with control of the npm registry could supply malicious packages. Mitigation: Users should audit package.json before running.

low_findings.title: Tarball extraction from local file
low_findings.description: The script extracts `shadcn-components.tar.gz` using `tar -xzf`. While sourced from the local skill directory, extracted files could overwrite existing files or create files outside intended directories. Line: `tar -xzf "$COMPONENTS_TARBALL" -C src/`

content.value_statement: Building complex artifacts with raw HTML is slow and limited. This skill provides a complete development environment with React, Tailwind CSS, and 40+ pre-built shadcn/ui components. Initialize a project, develop with modern tools, and bundle everything into a single portable HTML file.
actual_capabilities: Initialize React + Vite project with Tailwind CSS and shadcn/ui theming
Install 40+ pre-built shadcn/ui components including dialogs, forms, and cards
Configure path aliases and build tooling automatically
Bundle complete React application into single portable HTML file
Support Node.js 18+ with appropriate Vite version pinning
limitations: Requires pnpm package manager to be installed
Not suitable for simple single-file HTML artifacts
Bundle size may be large for complex applications
Does not include server-side rendering or backend integration

faq.question: What is the difference between this and inline HTML artifacts?
faq.answer: This skill supports complex state management, routing, and 40+ UI components. Simple artifacts use inline HTML directly.

faq.question: What are the system requirements?
faq.answer: Node.js 18 or higher and pnpm package manager are required. The skill supports macOS, Linux, and WSL.

faq.question: Can I add more shadcn components later?
faq.answer: Yes, you can add components manually or extend the setup script. The components are standard shadcn/ui patterns.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill only creates files in your project directory and installs npm packages. No data leaves your machine.

faq.question: Why is my bundle file so large?
faq.answer: React and all dependencies are inlined. Large bundles are normal. Consider removing unused components to reduce size.

faq.question: How does this compare to other artifact tools?
faq.answer: This skill provides a full development environment with type safety, hot reload, and the complete shadcn/ui component library.
